title: Mathematical Creativity Development Based on Traditional Music: Guqin Rhythm Pattern Analysis through Systematic Integrated Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic traditional instrument performance skills, understanding of music theory, and ability to perform basic statistical analysis and interpret graphs.
context.additional_context: Mathematical creativity development program utilizing the UNESCO intangible cultural heritage instrument Guqin (古琴). Conducted as a short-term workshop to enhance job expandability for current professionals, fostering problem-solving and creative thinking through an integrated music-mathematics approach

learning_goals: Over 80% of learners can explain the cultural significance and performance techniques of Guqin by connecting them to mathematical variables.
All participants create at least one probabilistic music structure by producing a traditional scale variation composition through VR simulation.
Each learner completes a mathematical rhythm pattern analysis report utilizing traditional music elements and visualizes it using graphs and statistical techniques.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
